The Magnolia Hotshots and the Alaska Aces joust for the PBA Governors' Cup championship starting on Wednesday, December 5, at 7 pm.

item.title: PBA: Travis, Lee and the text message that won Manila Clasico - ABS-CBN News
item.description:
PBA: Travis, Lee and the text message that won Manila Clasico  ABS-CBN News

50 points from Romeo Travis was the reason that Magnolia won in Game 4, but it was an early-morning text that won the Hotshots Manila Clasico.

item.title: Alaska vs. Magnolia series will revolve around defense - ESPN
item.description:
Alaska vs. Magnolia series will revolve around defense  ESPN

No two teams are more perfect to match up in the PBA Governors' Cup finals than the Alaska Aces and Magnolia Hotshots.

item.title: PBA: Playing against ex team, a non-issue for Magnolia's Romeo Travis - ABS-CBN News
item.description:

Romeo Travis, who played for Alaska in the 2015 Governors' Cup, eyes his first PBA title when Magnolia faces the Aces in this year's edition of the same ...

Romeo Travis channels LeBron James as Magnolia edges Ginebra  Rappler

The Hotshots import says he may have 'jinxed' himself after watching his pal and Lakers star miss crucial free throws before coming up clutch in the end.

item.title: Resounding semis win gives Magnolia long-sought redemption against Cone, Ginebra - FOX Sports Philippines
item.description:
Resounding semis win gives Magnolia long-sought redemption against Cone, Ginebra  FOX Sports Philippines

After getting their revenge on Barangay Ginebra, the Magnolia Hotshots are on the verge of getting their first championship since the departure of Tim Cone.

item.title: Ginebra stays alive with gutsy Game 3 win over Magnolia - Rappler

Ginebra stays alive with gutsy Game 3 win over Magnolia  Rappler

Justin Brownlee and LA Tenorio deliver awe-inspiring performances as the Gin Kings finally tally a victory in the best-of-five series.

item.title: Travis likes Magnolia's gritty Game 2 win over opening blowout - Rappler
item.description:
Travis likes Magnolia's gritty Game 2 win over opening blowout  Rappler

MANILA, Philippines – If it were up to Magnolia import Romeo Travis, he'd rather take hard-fought triumphs than lopsided ones. Travis highlighted the need to remain grounded and focused after the Hotshots claimed a 2-0 lead in the best-of-seven PBA Governors' Cup finals with a grueling 77-71 Game 2 win over Alaska on Friday, December 7. It was a far cry from Magnolia's 100-84 demolition of the Aces in the series-opener, but the 33-year-old likes it that way. "I think this is better. I'd rather win like this so we know next game that you can't get out and play any kind of way," Travis, who f...

item.title: PBA Finals: Magnolia gains 2-0 series upper hand after outlasting Alaska - CNN Philippines
item.description:
PBA Finals: Magnolia gains 2-0 series upper hand after outlasting Alaska  CNN Philippines

Metro Manila (CNN Philippines, December 7) — The Magnolia Hotshots edged out the Alaska, 77-71, in Game 2 of the 2018 PBA Governors' Cup finals Friday at the Smart Araneta Coliseum in Quezon City. Romeo Travis powered the Hotshots with 24 points and nine rebounds, while Ian Sangalang added 11 points and five rebounds. Down by one point, Jio Jalalon scored five straight markers to give Magnolia the lead with 15 seconds left in the contest. JVee Casio had a clean outside shot for the Aces in the ensuing play, but it went wide. Rafi Reavis sealed the victory for the Hotshots with a two-handed ...

item.title: Magnolia noses out Alaska for 2-0 lead in PBA finals - Rappler
item.description:
Magnolia noses out Alaska for 2-0 lead in PBA finals  Rappler

MANILA, Philippines – Jio Jalalon came through the clutch to propel Magnolia to a hard-fought 77-71 win over Alaska in Game 2 of the 2018 PBA Governors' Cup finals at the Araneta Coliseum on Friday, December 7. Despite finishing with just 7 points, Jalalon made them all count by scoring 4 of his side's last 6 points as the Hotshots gained a 2-0 lead in the best-of-seven championship affair. The Hotshots played catchup basketball throughout and even trailed by as much as 9 points before overtaking the Aces, 66-65, off a Paul Lee stepback jumper with 9:15 minutes left. It was a nip-and-tuck b...

item.title: Magnolia thwarts Alaska to draw first blood in PBA finals - Rappler
item.description:
Magnolia thwarts Alaska to draw first blood in PBA finals  Rappler

MANILA, Philippines – Magnolia rode on a blistering start and staved off Alaska's late stand en route to a 100-84 Game 1 win in the 2018 PBA Governors' Cup finals at the Mall of Asia Arena on Wednesday, December 5. Romeo Travis stuffed the stats sheet with 29 points, 13 rebounds and 5 assists while Mark Barroca stabilized the ship in cruchtime as the Hotshots drew first blood in the best-of-seven finals affair. The Hotshots saw their 21-point lead trimmed to just 8 points midway through the 4th quarter, 76-84, but Barroca restored order by scoring or assisting on their next 9 points for a 9...

item.title: More than 2 weeks since last PBA game, Magnolia and Alaska start finals clash - ABS CBN News
item.description:
ABS CBN News

Magnolia's Paul Lee (right) and Alaska's Vic Manuel are expected to be at the forefront of their respective teams' attack in their best-of-7 title series, which open Wednesday. PBA Media Bureau After more than 2 weeks out of the limelight, the PBA finally caps its 2017-18 campaign when the Governors' Cup finals between Magnolia and Alaska get underway at Mall of Asia Arena on Wednesday. It has been an action-packed past few days in Philippine basketball, with the UAAP Season 81 finals and the qualifiers for the 2019 FIBA World Cup serving as main draw. The PBA joins the busy week in local h...

item.title: Slaughter: Playing with Fajardo in Gilas a 'dream come true' - Rappler
item.description:
Slaughter: Playing with Fajardo in Gilas a 'dream come true'  Rappler

MANILA, Philippines – After years of being pitted against June Mar Fajardo, Greg Slaughter admitted it is a "dream come true" to play with the reigning four-time PBA Most Valuable Player in Gilas Pilipinas. The two towering centers will see action together for the Philippines for the first time as Gilas tangles with Kazakhstan at the start of the fifth window of the World Cup qualifiers on Friday, November 30. From the collegiate scene to the PBA, the two have always been considered fierce rivals, so it will be a fresh scene for Slaughter and Fajardo to share the floor, especially while don...

item.title: PBA: Magnolia dethrones Ginebra to advance to Governors' Cup finals - CNN Philippines
item.description:
PBA: Magnolia dethrones Ginebra to advance to Governors' Cup finals  CNN Philippines

Antipolo (CNN Philippines, November 16) — The Magnolia Hotshots ousted reigning champion Barangay Ginebra in Game 4, 112-108, to move on to the 2018 PBA Governors' Cup finals Friday at the Ynares Center. Import Romeo Travis carried the Hotshots with a monster outing 50 points on 20-of-26 shooting from the field and 13 rebounds. Ginebra took control of the tempo early in the contest and established a slim advantage in the first half. Magnolia's better shooting in the third quarter did not help its cause as Ginebra was able to maintain the lead going into the final canto. Trailing by four poi...

item.title: Ben Mbala almost played for Magnolia vs Ginebra - Rappler
item.description:
Ben Mbala almost played for Magnolia vs Ginebra  Rappler

ANTIPOLO CITY, Philippines – Ben Mbala almost debuted in the PBA for the Magnolia Hotshots. The former two-time UAAP Most Valuable Player served as a backup for Hotshots import Romeo Travis in case Barangay Ginebra forced a do-or-die Game 5 in their semifinals clash. Travis has been nursing a left hamstring injury and was unsure if he could keeping playing until Game 5 on Sunday, November 18. Needing an emergency import replacement, Hotshots head coach Chito Victolero bared that they tapped the services of Mbala, the former La Salle star who was coming off a stint with the Seoul Thunders in...

item.title: Alaska boots out Meralco for first finals in two years - Rappler
item.description:
Alaska boots out Meralco for first finals in two years  Rappler

MANILA, Philippines – For the first time in two years, Alaska is playing in a PBA finals. The Aces puffed enough gas to hack out a 99-92 win over Meralco and wrap up their best-of-five semifinals series in the 2018 PBA Governors' Cup in 4 games at the Cuneta Astrodome on Saturday, November 17. Import Mike Harris churned out 27 points, 14 rebounds and 3 steals and knocked down timely in the crucial 4th quarter as Alaska reached the championship round for the first time since the 2016 Commissioner's Cup. Alaska set up a finals date with the Magnolia, which ended Barangay Ginebra's reign in se...

item.title: Durham's chase for PBA title doesn't end in 3rd heartbreak - Rappler
item.description:
Durham's chase for PBA title doesn't end in 3rd heartbreak  Rappler

MANILA, Philippines – The third time wasn't the charm for Meralco's Allen Durham. But the two-time Best Import will keep on chasing that elusive PBA title even after the Bolts got the boot from the Alaska Aces in 4 games of their best-of-five semifinals series in the 2018 PBA Governors' Cup. "I'm still trying to get a ring so I'm going to keep working until I can't run or jump no more. We'll see what happens," he said. Durham had been hoping to carry the Bolts back to the Governors' Cup finals after they fell short of the title to Barangay Ginebra in the last two editions of the season-end...

item.title: Alaska's Mike Harris all respect for Meralco's Reynel Hugnatan - Rappler
item.description:
Alaska's Mike Harris all respect for Meralco's Reynel Hugnatan  Rappler

MANILA, Philippines – Mike Harris engaged in an intense battle with Allen Durham as Alaska moved one win away from the 2018 PBA Governors' Cup finals, but it wasn't just the Meralco import who earned his respect. Harris tipped his hat to the Bolts' Reynel Hugnatan after the 40-year-old veteran nearly played spoiler in the Aces' gritty 104-102 Game 3 win that gave the the team a 2-1 lead in the best-of-five semifinals affair. Hugnatan, who finished with 19 points, 5 rebounds and 5 assists, nearly forced overtime but saw his potential game-tying putback rim out to the relief of Harris and the...

item.title: Chris Gavina makes PBA comeback as part of Rain or Shine coaching staff - CNN Philippines
item.description:
Chris Gavina makes PBA comeback as part of Rain or Shine coaching staff  CNN Philippines

Metro Manila (CNN Philippines, November 16) — Chris Gavina is returning to the PBA after being tapped as an assistant coach of the Rain or Shine Elasto Painters. According to the league website, the 39-year-old Gavina met with Rain or Shine team governor Mamerto Mondragon Friday to formalize his appointment. Gavina started his PBA coaching journey as deputy tactician of the Kia franchise in 2016. He was responsible for steering the team to its only quarterfinals stint in the Governors' Cup of that year when it was then known as the Mahindra Enforcer. He was elevated to head coach this seaso...

item.title: Red-hot Meralco stuns Alaska, takes semis opener - Rappler
item.description:
Red-hot Meralco stuns Alaska, takes semis opener  Rappler

ANTIPOLO CITY, Philippines – Meralco's resurgence continued as it drew first blood against Alaska, 97-92, in their best-of-five semifinals series of the 2018 PBA Governors' Cup at the Ynares Center here on Sunday, November 11. Allen Durham delivered all-around numbers of 32 points, 14 rebounds and 6 assists to electrify the seventh-seeded Bolts to their seventh straight victory – and just two wins away from a third straight finals appearance in the season-ending conference. Chris Newsome finished with 16 points, 7 rebounds, 4 assists and 4 steals while Baser Amer chipped in 14 points, 4 reb...

item.title: PBA: Magnolia books first semis ticket, boots Blackwater out of playoffs - CNN Philippines
item.description:
PBA: Magnolia books first semis ticket, boots Blackwater out of playoffs  CNN Philippines

Metro Manila (CNN Philippines, November 6) — The Magnolia Hotshots are marching on to the PBA semifinals after beating Blackwater Elite behind the stellar play of Romeo Travis. The hardworking import tallied a triple double registering 18 points, 20 rebounds and 12 assists in their 103-99 victory Tuesday at the SMART-Araneta Coliseum. Magnolia, which owned the win-once bonus entering the contest, mustered a late rally after trailing by as much as seven points midway through the fourth quarter. Paul Lee tallied his own double-double, coming up with a game-best 22 points while grabbing 12 reb...

item.title: Yeng Guiao: 'Major revamp' coming for NLEX - Rappler
item.description:
Yeng Guiao: 'Major revamp' coming for NLEX  Rappler

MANILA, Philippines – After NLEX closed out the 2018 PBA season with two blowout losses, head coach Yeng Guiao hints of a "major revamp" for the 2019 PBA season. "Last two games were really disappointing and I felt that more than disappointing, they’re embarrassing," admitted Guiao after absorbing a 75-111 loss to semis-bound Barangay Ginebra. "We can start looking forward to the next season – try to improve the team and upgrade it, rebuild the team. I think we have 8 to 9 players expiring so there’s going to be a major revamp coming." Prior to the 2018 Governors' Cup quarterfinals, the ...

item.title: PBA: 'Manila Clasico' semis set as Ginebra demolishes NLEX - CNN Philippines
item.description:
PBA: 'Manila Clasico' semis set as Ginebra demolishes NLEX  CNN Philippines

Metro Manila (CNN Philippines, November 6) — Barangay Ginebra is moving on to the 2018 PBA Governors' Cup semifinals. Ginebra eliminated the NLEX Road Warriors with a 111-75 rout Tuesday at the Smart Araneta Coliseum in Quezon City. Import Justin Brownlee registered a triple-double for Ginebra with 13 points, 10 rebounds, and 10 assists. Ginebra proved why it's the best team this conference after dominating both ends of the floor in the entire match. The Road Warriors just could not find a bright spot as Ginebra pulled away in the second half. It was a special night for Jeff Chan, as the Gi...

item.title: Marqus Blakely on Tim Cone: 'I miss him, too' - Rappler
item.description:
Marqus Blakely on Tim Cone: 'I miss him, too'  Rappler

MANILA, Philippines – As fate would have it, the coach Marqus Blakely helped win a rare PBA Grand Slam denied him from reaching the playoffs for the first time. Blakely will go on an early vacation this time as his TNT KaTropa succumbed to a 93-112 loss to his former mentor Tim Cone and the Barangay Ginebra in the Governors' Cup on Sunday, November 4. A win would have put the KaTropa into a playoff for the last quarterfinals berth against Meralco, but Cone and the Gin Kings proved to be the mightier squad to come away with the dominant victory. "I really don't know how I feel just yet," the...

item.title: Jared Dillinger makes surprise comeback count - Rappler
item.description:
Jared Dillinger makes surprise comeback count  Rappler

MANILA, Philippines – Jared Dillinger made a surprise return from injury and stepped up in crucial stretches to help the Meralco Bolts stay alive against Phoenix Fuel Masters in the 2018 PBA Governors' Cup quarterfinals on Wednesday, November 7. The veteran guard was subbed at the start of the second half after Cliff Hodge hurt his back. The Bolts captain did not return to the game. "As soon as Cliff hit the deck, I knew that coach was going to throw me in in the fire. [The] original plan was just to be with the team and kind of get ready for the semis if we make the semis," said Dillinger...

item.title: Meralco overpowers Phoenix, forces do-or-die for semis slot - Rappler
item.description:
Meralco overpowers Phoenix, forces do-or-die for semis slot  Rappler

MANILA, Philippines – Meralco shot the lights out in the second half as the Bolts turned back the Phoenix Fuel Masters, 90-74, to force a winner-take-all for a semis berth in the PBA Governors' Cup on Wednesday, November 7, at the Cuneta Astrodome in Pasay City. Allen Durham fueled the Bolts' comeback to finish with a double-double of 26 points and 16 boardswhile Chris Newsome also chipped in 16 points. "I repeat it over and over again. Tonight it's about our defense," said Meralco head coach Norman Black. "In the first half, we struggled because Phoenix is a very good defensive team. Their...

item.title: Alaska boots out San Miguel, nails semis berth - Rappler
item.description:
Alaska boots out San Miguel, nails semis berth  Rappler

MANILA, Philippines – The Alaska Aces finally got their revenge game. Banking on a huge 2nd half, the Aces disposed of the San Miguel Beermen, 96-85, to clinch a semis spot in the 2018 PBA Governors' Cup on Wednesday, November 7, at the Cuneta Astrodome in Pasay City. Mike Harris posted a massive double-double of 25 points and 17 rebounds for the Aces, who were denied a finals berth by the Beermen in the 2018 PBA Commissioner's Cup. Simon Enciso had 15 points built on a 3-of-7 clip from beyond the arc as the Aces also clamped down on the Beermen defensively. Alaska will face the winner of t...

item.title: Phoenix nails twice-to-beat edge, No. 2 ranking vs Blackwater - Rappler
item.description:
Phoenix nails twice-to-beat edge, No. 2 ranking vs Blackwater  Rappler

MANILA, Philippines – Phoenix secured the coveted twice-to-beat incentive heading into the quarterfinals of the 2018 PBA Governors' Cup after a dramatic 97-91 win over Blackwater at the Araneta Coliseum on Sunday, November 4. Calvin Abueva submitted a team-high 25 points on top of 8 rebounds as the Fuel Masters hiked their record to 8-3 to secure the No. 2 ranking and set a playoffs date with the No. 7 team, which has yet to be determined. The Fuel Masters actually forged a three-way tie with Magnolia and Alaska but gained the highest ranking among the 3 teams by virtue of a superior quotie...

item.title: Tiu notches new career-high to lift import-less Rain or Shine over NLEX - Rappler
item.description:
Tiu notches new career-high to lift import-less Rain or Shine over NLEX  Rappler

MANILA, Philippines – Chris Tiu notched a new career-high in points as Rain or Shine ended a dismal PBA Governors' Cup campaign on a winning note with a 107-101 win over NLEX at the Araneta Coliseum on Saturday, November 3. Tiu, who is reported to retire by the end of the season with his contract expiring, delivered 30 big points on top of 5 assists and 4 rebounds to power the Elasto Painters to their third win despite missing import Terrence Watson. The 33-year-old fired 17 of his output in the second half as Rain or Shine swung a 46-51 deficit at halftime to a lead that swelled to as larg...

item.title: Ginebra seals No. 1 ranking, boots TNT out of playoffs - Rappler
item.description:
Ginebra seals No. 1 ranking, boots TNT out of playoffs  Rappler

MANILA, Philippines – Barangay Ginebra rode on Justin Brownlee's triple-double to whip TNT, 112-93, and secure the No. 1 ranking in the playoffs of the 2018 PBA Governors' Cup at the Araneta Coliseum on Sunday, November 4. Brownlee submitted 31 points, 16 rebounds, 11 assists, 3 blocks and 3 steals as the Gin Kings, who improved to 9-2, determined the final quarterfinals pairings by booting the KaTropa out of playoffs contention. Boasting a twice-to-beat incentive, Ginebra needs just one win against No. 8 NLEX in the quarterfinals to reach the semifinals and move a step closer in their bid ...

item.title: Meralco zaps San Miguel to boost playoff chances - Rappler
item.description:
Meralco zaps San Miguel to boost playoff chances  Rappler

MANILA, Philippines – Just a few weeks ago, Meralco looked headed for an early vacation. But the Bolts may just steer clear of that after manhandling San Miguel, 111-81, in the 2018 PBA Governors' Cup at the Araneta Coliseum on Saturday, November 3. Allen Durham dropped 35 points, 26 rebounds, 7 assists, 2 blocks and 2 steals as the Bolts ended the elimination round with a fourth straight win to improve to 5-6 and assure themselves at least a playoff for the last quarterfinals berth. If TNT (4-6) drops its game on Sunday against Barangay Ginebra, Meralco will clinch its playoffs ticket at 7...

item.title: Gilas head coach Yeng Guiao to meet with PBA board - Rappler
item.description:
Gilas head coach Yeng Guiao to meet with PBA board  Rappler

MANILA, Philippines – Team Pilipinas' preparation for the next window of the FIBA World Cup qualifiers is expected to start shortly as national coach Yeng Guiao presents his program in a special meeting with the PBA board of governors Tuesday next week, November 4, at the PBA office in Libis, Quezon City. The Nationals resume their chase for a spot in the 2019 World Cup in China with back-to-back home games at the Mall of Asia Arena against Kazakhstan on November 30 and Iran on December 3. Guiao is expected to name his pool of 18 to 20 players during the meeting to be presided by TNT KaTrop...

item.title: From boring to exciting - SunStar Philippines
item.description:
From boring to exciting  SunStar Philippines

WE ARE now into the homestretch, ensuring an electric frenzy heading into the incentive-laden quarterfinals. Almost complete is the Top 8 cast from the 12 PBA (Philippine Basketball Association) teams. They get the boot but the four ousted teams—Rain or Shine, Northport, Columbian Dyip and either TNT-Katropa or Meralco—get to enjoy an early, extended Christmas vacation. And by the beauty of the tournament format that makes Commissioner Willie Marcial prouder than proud no end, the Top 4 quarterfinalists need only one win each to advance. So far, only Magnolia and Alaska have officially secu...

item.title: Ginebra reasserts mastery over Magnolia in Manila Clasico - Rappler
item.description:
Ginebra reasserts mastery over Magnolia in Manila Clasico  Rappler

MANILA, Philippines – Barangay Ginebra staved off a late scare from Magnolia to triumph in another edition of the Manila Clasico, 93-86, in the 2018 PBA Governors' Cup at the Araneta Coliseum on Sunday, October 28. The Gin Kings nearly squandered a 22-point lead but proved the steadier team in the endgame to beat the Hotshots for the seventh straight elimination round game and secure a twice-to-beat incentive in the playoffs with an 8-2 card. Comfortably ahead with less 3 minutes left, 89-75, Ginebra looked like it already had the victory in the bag only to witness Magnolia unleash a 9-0 bl...

item.title: Alaska rides on late surge vs NorthPort to book twice-to-beat edge - Rappler
item.description:
Alaska rides on late surge vs NorthPort to book twice-to-beat edge  Rappler

MANILA, Philippines – Alaska clinched the second twice-to-beat incentive in the playoffs of the 2018 PBA Governors' Cup following a gritty 95-85 win over the also-ran NorthPort at the Araneta Coliseum on Sunday, October 28. Mike Harris recorded a monster double-double of 27 points, 25 rebounds and 5 assists to power the Aces to their eighth win in 11 games and a sure spot within the Top 4, which affords them a win-once edge in the quarterfinals. Although already eliminated, the Batang Pier were looking to play spoiler in the rankings after leading 78-75 midway through the 4th quarter off ba...

item.title: Blackwater toys with Columbian for piece of 3rd place - Rappler
item.description:
Blackwater toys with Columbian for piece of 3rd place  Rappler

BIÑAN CITY, Philippines – The hot-starting Blackwater preyed on Columbian in a convincing 120-99 win to snap a two-game skid in the 2018 PBA Governors' Cup at the Alonte Sports Arena here on Saturday, October 27. Henry Walker fired 26 points on a perfect 9-of-9 clip on top of 11 rebounds to lead 4 other players in twin digits as the Elite forged a three-way logjam at 3rd place with Phoenix and Alaska, which carry identical 7-3 cards. Thanks to a barrage of three-pointers, Blackwater built a 33-20 lead after the 1st quarter before pulling away for good with a 63-42 advantage at halftime. The...

item.title: San Miguel punches playoffs ticket as Fajardo returns - Rappler
item.description:
San Miguel punches playoffs ticket as Fajardo returns  Rappler

BIÑAN CITY, Philippines – San Miguel formalized its entry to the quarterfinals of the 2018 PBA Governors' Cup after whipping the also-ran Rain or Shine, 109-97, at the Alonte Sports Arena here on Saturday, October 27. Three players breached the 20-point mark as the Beermen extended their winning streak to 4 games and became the sixth team to make the playoffs with a 6-4 record just when June Mar Fajardo returned from injury. Christian Standhardinger submitted a double-double of 22 points, 18 rebounds and 4 assists to power San Miguel while import Kevin Murphy delivered a team-high 28 points...

item.title: San Miguel eliminates NorthPort, zeroes in on playoffs berth - Rappler
item.description:
San Miguel eliminates NorthPort, zeroes in on playoffs berth  Rappler

MANILA, Philippines – San Miguel zeroed in on a quarterfinals berth in the 2018 PBA Governors' Cup and eliminated NorthPort from playoffs contention following a 114-107 win at the Cuneta Astrodome on Wednesday, October 24. Christian Standhardinger frolicked in the paint with 21 points and 22 rebounds as the Beermen survived the Batang Pier's gallant stand in the final frame to notch their third straight win and improve to 5-4. The Beermen looked like they were in for a blowout win after leading by as much as 19 points but saw their advantage vanish with the Batang Pier tying the game midway...
